cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwestward across the north-western Caribbean, expected to cross the Yucatan Channel Tuesday night, enter the central Gulf of Mexico Wednesday–Thursday, and aim for the Louisiana Gulf Coast late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely south-central to southeast LA, near or west of Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect for western Cuba (Artemisa) and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico including Cozumel, and for Pinar del Rio, Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning for Cayman Islands and Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, then northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Alabama including Plaquemines Parish, LA
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of tropical-storm-force winds (34-63 kt) with a 50% chance overall; 22% chance of 50-kt winds; gusts near hurricane force possible if the center passes close to Plaquemines Parish late Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 4–7 ft above normally dry ground along southeast Louisiana coast, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches with locally higher totals possible Friday–Saturday, producing flash-flooding concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous seas and very rough surf from Thursday onward.
